Everyone who says the cure to recidivism is to lock them up for longer is missing the point.
First off, the US has more people in prison both in total numbers and per capita. There is no country on the planet which has more people locked up than ours, so you can't say we're not tough on crime.
The reason that the prison system in the US is bad at rehabilitation is that it doesn't practice rehabilitation.
If you look at the countries without a lock them up and throw away the key mentality, their recidivism rates are much lower. The reason is that their prisons are designed for two things: punishment and rehabilitation. American prisons are driven by "Let's get even!" instead of "Let's make this person a functioning member of society." Almost anyone who has served time in American prisons will tell you that the only thing they teach you is how to be a better criminal.
It's just crazy that people think America is soft on crime... we're a total police state.
